get.description: Gets a list of StoragePool operations.
Gets a list of Disk Pools in a subscription

200.description: Operation completed successfully; retrieved diskPools by subscription

get.description: Gets a list of DiskPools in a resource group.

200.description: Operation completed successfully; retrieved diskPools by resource group
OK -- Returned when the create or update operation is successfully completed.

201.description: Accepted -- Create or update request accepted; operation will complete asynchronously.

200.description: OK -- Returned when the update operation is successfully completed.

202.description: Accepted -- Update request accepted; operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Resource does not exist in the subscription.

202.description: Delete request accepted; operation will complete asynchronously.

200.description: Operation completed successfully; retrieved Disk pool.

get.description: Lists available Disk Pool Skus in an Azure location.
Gets the network endpoints of all outbound dependencies of a Disk Pool

post.description: The operation to start a Disk Pool.
Shuts down the Disk Pool and releases the compute resources. You are not billed for the compute resources that this Disk Pool uses.

get.description: Get iSCSI Targets in a Disk pool.

200.description: Operation completed successfully; retrieved iSCSI Targets in a Disk pool.

put.description: Create or Update an iSCSI Target.

200.description: OK -- Returned when the create or update operation is successfully completed.

201.description: Accepted -- Create or update request accepted; operation will complete asynchronously.

200.description: OK -- Returned when the update operation is successfully completed.

202.description: Accepted -- Update request accepted; operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Resource does not exist in the subscription.

202.description: Delete request accepted; operation will complete asynchronously.

200.description: Operation completed successfully; retrieved iSCSI Target.

category.description: The type of service accessed by the App Service Environment, e.g., Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Active Directory.

endpoints.description: The endpoints that the App Service Environment reaches the service at.

EndpointDependency.description: A domain name that a service is reached at, including details of the current connection status.

domainName.description: The domain name of the dependency.

endpointDetails.description: The IP Addresses and Ports used when connecting to DomainName.

EndpointDetail.description: Current TCP connectivity information from the App Service Environment to a single endpoint.

ipAddress.description: An IP Address that Domain Name currently resolves to.

port.description: The port an endpoint is connected to.

latency.description: The time in milliseconds it takes for a TCP connection to be created from the App Service Environment to this IpAddress at this Port.

isAccessible.description: Whether it is possible to create a TCP connection from the App Service Environment to this IpAddress at this Port.
